entry.title: newsletter #71
entry.content:
Hello Folks!

This is the last #TechThursday for 2014 (even if it’s Wednesday :P ) .

It has been an amazing year here at Namshi, our tech stack evolved a lot, new challenges, new technologies, new ppl… can’t wait to see what will happen in 2015!

What’s you new year resolution? Have you ever thought to be part of our team? :) JOIN US!

Happy new year from the Namshi Tech team

Here is usual the list with interesting links to keep you busy after you wake up from new year’s eve:

  • CSSconf EU 2014 | Rachel Andrew: CSS Grid Layout

  • Microservices – Not A Free Lunch!

  • Amazon VPC Peering with CloudAMQP

  • Dispatches from Anywhere: Life as a Remote Worker

  • The future of Docker

  • Docker in 5 minutes

  • Turbo charge your logs – Slides

  • First Experiences with BDD – Video

  • A collection of .gitignore templates

  • Very easy to use installer with ansible / vagrant / virtual box to install Symfony with a simple single command.

  • How to Batch Update Git Commit Messages

  • Polyfills suck, use a featurefill instead

  • Speeding up HTTPS with session resumption

  • THE NEXT UX CHALLENGE ON THE WEB: GAINING OFFLINE TRUST

  • 4 Architecture Issues When Scaling Web Applications: Bottlenecks, Database, CPU, IO

  • php-fraud-detect: Checker of fraud requests.

  • How Much Testing is Too Much?

  • 22 Pictures That Prove That 2014 Is The Damn Future

  • How can React and Flux help us create better Angular applications?
